articles.title: DPRK's Proposal Supported in Nepal
articles.content:
DPRK's Proposal Supported in Nepal 
    Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Jala Nath Kanal, chief of the International Department of the Central Committee of the Nepal Communist Party (United Marxist-Leninist), in a statement on March 8 said that he was much pleased with a proposal set forth by the DPRK side at the six-way talks in Beijing and welcomed the positive proposal.
 He expressed his regret at the fact that at the talks the U.S. did not take a positive attitude for the settlement of the nuclear issue on the Korean peninsula.    
 We are firmly convinced that only when all the countries concerned including the U.S. make positive contributions, can  permanent peace be preserved on the Korean peninsula, the reunification of Korea be realized and the Korean people live under the circumstances of peace and prosperity, he said.

U.S. Forces S. Korea to Bolster Combat Equipment of Its Troops in Iraq
articles.content:
U.S. Forces S. Korea to Bolster Combat Equipment of Its Troops in Iraq 
    Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The U.S. Army recently forced south Korea to reinforce combat equipment of additional troops of south Korea to be sent to Iraq, according to south Korean KBS.
 When a fact-finding group of the south Korean army dispatched to Iraq informed the U. S. Army side in Iraq of the combat equipment of the additional troops of south Korea to be sent to Iraq, the latter claimed that such a level of combat equipment is not enough to cope with the resistance forces in Iraq and it is difficult to recognize the independent right to control the specified area unless combat equipment is reinforced. The U.S. Army pressed for reinforcing the combat equipment of the additional troops of south Korea with tanks, helicopters, etc.

Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Ri Hyon Sam
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Ri Hyon Sam
    Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il today sent a wreath to the bier of Ri Hyon Sam, a TV cameraman of the DPRK Radio and TV Broadcasting Committee, expressing deep condolences over his death.
